Elvie_Shane:
{{short description|American country music singer}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Elvie Shane | image = | image_upright = | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1988|05|22}} | birth_place = [[Caneyville, Kentucky]], U.S. | origin = [[Nashville, Tennessee]], U.S. | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | instrument = Vocals, guitar | years_active = 2020-present | label = [[BBR Music Group|Wheelhouse]] }} '''Elvie Shane''' (born May 22, 1988) is an American [[country music]] singer. He is signed to [[BBR Music Group]] and in 2020 he released his debut single "[[My Boy (Elvie Shane song)|My Boy]]", which has charted on [[Country Airplay]]. Shane was born in [[Caneyville, Kentucky]], where he grew up singing in his church and listening to country music that his father played. After attending [[Western Kentucky University]], he dropped out of college to focus on music. He began performing publicly in 2012, which led to him competing on ''[[American Idol]]'' in 2016. Although he was eliminated in the first round, he released multiple songs online including "County Roads" and "My Boy". In 2020, he was signed to [[BBR Music Group|Wheelhouse]], which released "My Boy" to country radio.{{cite web | url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/elvie-shane-mn0003938176/biography | title=Elvie Shane biography | publisher=AllMusic | accessdate=February 13, 2021}} Shane wrote the song with Russell Sutton, Lee Starr, and Nick Columbia.{{cite web | url=https://tasteofcountry.com/elvie-shane-my-boy/ | title=Elvie Shane's 'My Boy' Tells a Loving Stepfather's Story [Listen] | work=Taste of Country | date=20 October 2020 | accessdate=February 13, 2021}} In December 2020, he released a music video which was directed by [[Peter Zavadil]].{{cite web | url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/music/elvie-shane-honors-stepdads-my-boy-video/ | title=Elvie Shane Honors Stepdads in Moving 'My Boy' Video | website=Sounds Like Nashville | date=18 December 2020 | accessdate=February 13, 2021}} "My Boy" also made the [[Country Airplay]] charts, reaching the top 10 of the chart in September 2021.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/country-airplay/2021-09-18|title=Country Airplay Songs: September 18, 2021|magazine=Billboard|access-date=September 21, 2021|url-access=subscription}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:10em;"| Title ! scope="col" style="width:19em;"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''[[Backslider (album)|Backslider]]'' | * Release date: October 29, 2021{{efn-ua|''Backslider'' was released on October 29, 2021 exclusively for digital download/streaming. It was released to CD on February 11, 2022.{{cite web|url=https://store.elvieshane.com/|title=Elvie Shane Official Merchandise|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20220105171211/https://store.elvieshane.com/|archivedate=January 5, 2022|accessdate=February 12, 2022}}}} * Label: [[BBR Music Group|Wheelhouse]] * Formats: [[Compact disc|CD]], [[Music download|digital download]], [[Streaming media|streaming]] |- ! scope="row"| ''Damascus'' | * Release: April 19, 2024{{Cite web|url=https://musicrow.com/2024/01/elvie-shane-to-release-sophomore-album-damascus-in-april/|title=Elvie Shane To Release Sophomore Album 'Damascus' In April|first=Madison|last=Hahnen|date=January 8, 2024|publisher=Music Row|accessdate=January 15, 2024}} * Label: Wheelhouse * Format: Digital download, streaming |} ===Extended plays=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! scope="col" style="width:10em;"| Title ! scope="col" style="width:19em;"| EP details |- ! scope="row"| ''County Roads'' | * Release date: April 23, 2021 * Label: Wheelhouse * Formats: Digital download, streaming |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of singles, with selected chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Year ! colspan="3"| Peak positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| [[List of music recording certifications|Certifications]] ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Album |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="65"| [[Billboard Hot 100|US]]
